sentences.en: A greater cause for resentment is the discrepancy in pay.
sentences.cn: 导致愤怒的更主要原因是报酬上的差异.

sentences.en: All her feelings of resentment just came pouring out.
sentences.cn: 她一股脑儿倾吐出所有的怨恨.

sentences.en: Already the awards are causing resentment in the lower ranks of council officers.
sentences.cn: 奖项已使政务委员会的低层官员们愤愤不平。

sentences.en: Don't let your resentment build up.
sentences.cn: 别让你的怨恨郁积起来.

sentences.en: Everyone feels resentment at being treated unfairly.
sentences.cn: 每个人都会为受到不公平的待遇而感到愤慨.

sentences.en: His resentment blinds his good sense.
His resentment of her behaviour was becoming more vociferous.
sentences.cn: 他越来越大声地表达对她行为的厌恶。

sentences.en: I detect an undercurrent of resentment towards the new proposals.
sentences.cn: 我察觉到对新提案有一股潜在的不满情绪。

sentences.en: If they are unemployed it's bound to breed resentment.
sentences.cn: 如果他们失去工作，一定会产生怨恨。

sentences.en: My resentment of her slowly began to fade.
sentences.cn: 我对她的怨恨开始渐渐消退了。

sentences.en: She cherished a deep resentment under the rose towards her employer.
sentences.cn: 她暗中对她的雇主怀恨在心.

sentences.en: She expressed resentment at being interviewed by a social worker.
sentences.cn: 她表达了对被一位社工采访的愤恨。

sentences.en: She harboured resentment against her stepmother.
That's a lot of people smouldering with resentment.
sentences.cn: 许多人的心里都在愤愤不平。

sentences.en: This issue has aroused much resentment among the masses.
sentences.cn: 这个问题在民众中间引起了强烈的不满。

trans.tran_en: a feeling of anger because something has happened that you think is unfair
